intro: Appunia sparsiflora, commonly known as the sparse-flowered appunia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are usually pinnately divided, with a feathery appearance. Appunia sparsiflora is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in dry climates.
